intro: Hieracium oxyodon, commonly known as the hooked hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, featuring rough, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a cluster, and are followed by hooked, bristly seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Hieracium oxyodon is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
